meanings.definition: The retention of juvenile characteristics in an adult organism.
meanings.sent1: The paedomorphism of the salamander meant it kept its tadpole-like features even as an adult.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the paedomorphism of certain species to understand why they retained youthful traits.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphism of the puppy made it look like a forever young furry friend.
meanings.sent4: Her paedomorphism was like a time machine, keeping her forever in a state of playful innocence.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphism of the flower made it seem like it never wanted to grow up, always staying small and delicate.

meanings.definition: The occurrence of sexual maturity in a juvenile organism.
meanings.sent1: The paedomorphism of the tadpole surprised the researchers when it suddenly reached reproductive age.
meanings.sent2: In some species, paedomorphism is a crucial stage in the life cycle for successful reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphism of the caterpillar turning into a butterfly was like a magical transformation.
meanings.sent4: Her paedomorphism bloomed like a flower, marking the beginning of a new phase in her life.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphism of the young bird signaled its readiness to start a family of its own.
